text.tspan: Anyone who’s dealt with personal demons knows that when we ignore things we don’t like,
they have a way of growing larger and more menacing. Alternatively, facing the ugliness in or
around us gives us a chance to transform it into something good, true, or beautiful.
The same can be said about large groups and societies. Censorship - the societal equivalent
to psychological repression, the “Don’t think about that!” - doesn’t actually defeat ideas, good
or bad. It just pushes them to the Fringe. And the Fringe will always exist to receive them.
There the ideas will fester and grow (mingling with other “problematic” ideas, no less), bound
to eventually re-enter the public scene, modified just enough to bypass or dismantle filters that
pushed them out last time.
This is a direct implication of basic memetics. Ideas evolve to survive - the truth is a secondary
concern in this Darwinian struggle. To cancel nazism so hard that it goes away is as ludicrous
a proposition as eliminating all species of mosquitoes in the world. We are not that mighty. If
we try, new forms will emerge specifically designed by evolution to resist such eradication
The Ever-Present Fringe
Author name
2 months ago
All Permapost posts are permanent
and impossible for anyone to delete.
All you need to post is a web3 wallet
like MetaMask and some xDai or ETH.
All Permapost authors are pseudonymous
by default and cannot be deplatformed.
